comments.body: If this gets added they should make it so that you can ask them as well

This is similar to a few posts about gaining the ability to play your single player worlds cross platform without having to pay for a server/realm when it is for your own use anyway. Something that can already be done from system files but is very awkward and time consuming.
Please add this it would help a lot of people
They should make it to where you can choose to upload your world to any other device/console/computer that your Minecraft bedrock account is connected to
I agree to this and highly suggest this in a near future update
Yeah I need to move my worlds from my old account so this would be a good way to do that
This would work great with worlds that have complex builds
we need this. I have a cool world with my friends but they quit Minecraft and I never see the world again. Please Mojang.
I want this on mobile. It would also be cool if you could share your world with another person. Like you could send them a link so they could try your world.
I honestly expected touch controls would be an option at launch, since it's already in other versions. Maybe I shouldn't use my switch like a tablet, but I want that choice.
@VulcanMushroom I expected it too...
I commented that too! Hopefully some windows team or minecraft code editor listens to you!
We can use the touch keyboard on the screen already. Quite honestly, I'm surprised we can't use touch controls outside the menus.
I’ve noticed you can select stuff in your hotbar with touch controls, at least.

Yeah.
It is not switch it is called button :)

It does make alot of sense, if you haven't experienced joy-con drift and had it mess up your play experience then you probably havent owned a switch for too long. touch controls should at the very least be an option.
Tuot với
And keyboard and mouse
Not sure if this does anything but in Touch controls, there is an option to turn off Torch only affects Hobart. It’s there on other bedrock platforms.

Yeah
If You broke your joy cons You can play minecraft
The only reason I agree is cause I've been dealing with drifting really really bad lately and has gotten me killed ingame a few times so a touchscreen option like pocket edition would really help

I've been wondering why the Switch version doesn't have an option to use touch controls, like on a phone. The Switch version is the perfect platform to have touch controls. I don't know why Mojang couldn't implement it.
Using a resource pack you can enable touch controls in the menu and they stay permanently enabled
Listen to him!!
I got a glitch that showed the joystick (MCPE joystick) when clicking on the screen but it didn't work but I think it's patched
Yes Please add this!  My Joycons are really glitchy somtimes so i would like smth like this as a backup.
Where's the settings button?
Its good

It's in need of some huge improvements:

1. The black background should be centered

2. The player name should be re-added

3. Buttons like the Achievements / Screenshot should be next to the friends button

4. PC and Mobile should have different sized buttons

5. The player skin / character creator should have an option to be able to switch it to be on the right side of the screen or the left side 

Improvements like these would really make it better
Why does this redesign still use the old buttons and not the redesigned ones present in previous OreUI redesigns? Is this a placeholder?

Me agrada como se ve, pero me gustaría tener ahí un acceso rápido a ajustes como la perspectiva del jugador (primera persona, tercera persona), distancia de renderizado y algunas más para que sea más cómodo y práctico para quienes jugamos en móvil
Looks good and refreshing from the screenshot, gonna try that when it eventually lets me update my beta/preview

the new OreUi in general feels really unnecessary and most feedback from bedrock players is negative as 1. it doesnt feel right (especially mixed with the regular ui, sicne it was half released at random for official updstes instead of remaining in previews only) 2. there is no need for a new UI at all, the old one was fine and no one complained. 3. it feels like a cheap attempt at making a mobile friendly UI even tho that is already a thing. forcing it on all devices and not being toggleable is NOT a good thing. i really hope you realize its not what the community wants.

I prefer the old ui.

Its buttons are of a nicer scale. This ones buttons are too small for mobile.

Settings is a commonly used button, yet on this new ui, its not one of the large buttons

The players usernames no longer displayed, it should be displayed.

I'm not entirely sure why, but the player avatar, and the friends button appear like theyre not aligned at all, and look off when in their position in the new UI.

The game is paused indicator has a position thats not too obvious. It should be in the empty space in the middle, where its more obvious, and visible. 

PLEASE add a toggle to use the old UI, like how theres a toggle for pocket and classic UI

 

This change is uneccessary. If mojang wants to make a new UI thats more friendly for mobile, it should be mobile exclusive, and have larger buttons than this.
I like how minimal it is and you can see the middle of the screen

Visually the menu is an improvement, however the big problem is the settings button, and the marketplace button. The button below "Resume Game" used to be a full sized settings button. Now, it's a marketplace button, with the settings button being a tiny button at the bottom.

This is, pretty obviously, a terrible change. It feels like it was a malicious change, relying on users' muscle memory to get them to accidentally enter the marketplace.

Swap the positions of the settings and marketplace buttons, or have 4 full size buttons like before. if you have 3 full size buttons and then a few smaller ones, the marketplace should not be wasting one of those big button spots.

I don't like that "browse add-ons" is right in between the large buttons for "resume game" and "save and quit" now, it's not something that most people use while in-game compared to the game settings so it should probably be one of the smaller buttons instead while the settings are moved back to the middle spot. Otherwise I do like it, it feels more natural.
It’s very good! I say the only change it needs is the settings button. Please make it a gear symbol. It would look great epic.
They should be fixing both the old and (especially) new UI instead of making these unnecessary changes.
I think the "Go to feedback site" should be replaced with the settings button, as the settings button is more used than the go to the feedback site.

I don't know if this is possible but could the old menu still be kept in 1.21.110? I know from .110 previews that the player list and permissions screen have already been moved to the new social drawer but with the old style it creates a very big empty gray section on the right with only a very minimalistic button on the top. I really like the new menu btw!

I absolutely love this new UI! Thank you so much for the hard work. My feedback is for the controller input; to have all buttons be virtually aligned to the left side, so that there is no need to move to the Dressing room on the right, to then go up to the Friend/Players list using the D-pad

Having the X & Y buttons still being mapped to screenshot and to enter the dressing room is still a nice feature

I personally like this look for the menu, but I believe that it would be better (both functionally and visually) if the settings and feedback buttons were swapped out. The buttons on the left look as if they could be centered better (to be more specific, there is too little space before the darkened area ends) and the friends/player list button feels out of place. Maybe it could be moved to the left side as well or have another darkened area behind it? Generally speaking, a lot of the things in this menu feel unaligned (in a bad way), but, if these things were fixed, it could probably be a major improvement from what is currently avaiable in the game.
I feel like the paper doll should move somewhere else or just make it in your profile. And please make it oresui

The "Browse Add-Ons!" button should never have priority over the Settings button. The average player is pausing the screen to either temporarily stop gameplay to attend to other matters, or change a game setting, NOT to buy content from the market place.

It looks nice but I think it can be improved. First I think the main buttons should be at the center like java and legacy edition and should be smaller so that you can still see your game. I really think that it's very inconvenient having to look completely to the left or right to see the buttons and It'll get annoying. I also think the settings should be one of the main buttons instead of the smaller ones since it's usually what most people would pause the game for. Lastly I think the game hud should still be visible while paused and I also think there should be a button to hide the hud in the pause menu since controller and touch doesn't have that feature because of the lack of binds. In my opinion I think the menu looks like it's more toward mobile than any other platform. Since the buttons are on the sidr it's easy for touch users to navigate. However people on monitors or TVs like me would rather have everything on the center of the screen because it would easier for that person to immediately find the buttons they need instead of having to go on a scavenger hunt to find the achievements tab. But that's all the criticism I have so far on the menu and I hope these changes happen.
Honestly it sucks, to me even the current one looks better. I mean where even is the friends tab?? And whats with the obsession with minimalism?? Add some color some interest something attractive.

It's very nice visually. But I wish they'd swap the position of the settings button with the "Go to feedback site" button, settings should be given more priority.
Also... I wish they'd add an extra button where the player can have settings at their fingertips, selecting settings like FOV, render distance, or music volume. And by pressing that button, you'll have those settings available to change more quickly. Just a suggestion.
But they go very well with the redesigned menus in Bedrock Edition.

Settings should be a prioritised icon on the main 3 tiles instead of the feedback one

apart from that, looks good!

The add-ons should not prioritize the settings. I like the concept, but seeing the word "settings" makes things a lot more easy. Overall, this does clean up the settings menu, and I can actually see what's going on when I'm paused. Just one small change and it's perfect imo.

It would be nice to switch the addons search button with the settings button. I use settings a lot for video settings and pack logs for instance. Having settings be closer and more bigger would be excellent.

The Browse Add-Ons button should never have priority over the Settings button, It's fine that they want to sell their addons, but if they're implementing so many "accessibility" improvements, they should start with the menu and make navigation much easier.
Where are the OreUI buttons?

This is great, but what if the layout were like this:

MINECRAFT

Resume Game

Invite to Game

Save & Quit

'A' 'B' 'C' 'D'

 

 

A = Options/Settings

B = Achievements

C = Marketplace (or Browse Addons)

D = Screenshot

 

This would be a good way to make the pause menu ui cleaner, but others might have better ideas!
Can you make the icon pixel size the same size as the text pixel size? (specifically the friends icon) It's an inconsistency that I wish I hadn't noticed.
Settings button needs to be on the main screen. No reason for add ons to be a prominent button
Changing the place of the settings button is a horrible idea. It should remain among the big buttons, not become a small one.

Honestly, I agree that the game menu needs changes, but this new design has many things that I dislike.
1- Settings should be placed on the main buttons.
2- The UI design should already include the new OreUI look.
3- The availability, location, and size of the buttons seem to have been designed just for mobile (I suggest including different screens for each device/"maybe for PC something more similar to Java").
4- The black bar in the background gives the interface a heavy feel (either make the entire screen dark, or keep it clear).
5- Option to swap the sides of the buttons on mobile.
6- The buttons are too far to the corner of the screen, leaving a strange gap in the middle (and the buttons in the dark bar look very large and square, and squeezed together).

I love the look and layout of this new screen.

I despise the change made in the ordering of the buttons. Being offered to browse add-ons constantly while building in my vanilla survival world of 6 years is insulting enough; I don't need it to also be the most accessible button whenever I open the the pause menu. I change my settings, including render distance, audio balance, FOV, and those wonderful vibrant visuals, very frequently. I do not want to have to scroll past the entire "suggested" section in order to get to the part of the pause menu I find most useful.

Please make it: Resume. Settings. Save & Quit. Maybe a tiny button for marketplace below those.

At the very least, return it to the current ordering of Resume, Settings, Add-ons, Save & Quit.

To me, the idea of buying an add-on from the settings menu feels like if a Souls game had a pop-up mod-fight asking you to purchase the dlc, and this is only heightened by the idea of doing this instead of changing my intended settings.

I would like to share some feedback regarding the new look of the pause menu in Minecraft Bedrock. I understand that the purpose of the update is to modernize and improve the player experience, but I believe it would be interesting to offer the possibility to switch between the new design and the old one through an option in the settings.

Many players have a special attachment to the classic menu, whether for nostalgia or aesthetic preference, and I believe that including this option would please a large part of the community.

In addition, if this toggle option is added to the pause menu, I think it would also be important for it to apply to all of the game’s new interfaces.

Thank you for your effort in keeping Minecraft always updated and relevant, and I hope this suggestion can contribute to making the game even better for all of us.

It would be nice if it were possible to choose between the new and the old UI, just as you can already switch between “Classic” and “Pocket.” If it’s already possible to switch between these options, why not do the same with the entire UI?
Hudson

Seriously if the Settings button stays there I might actually gonna freak, I'm an Add-on Creator and I frequently use the Settings Menu, Please Put the Settings button back below the Resume Game button  :)
Replace the settings and marketplace button so it’s already 100x better.
The UI is nice but please switch the position of the settings and the marketplace buttons, the settings are more important than the marketplace for us the players
Wy i think it is extrem ugly and you cant See fast how many Players are in the world or how wude IT wen you cann choose the Version ui you can have i wud Like IT .
It's super bad please remove it to the old or make a setting to change it like the world's menu.
Its not bad, however im sure everybody would love the Editions / Java edition style or something like that

As a bedrock player this new UI feels uncomfortable and unnecessary the space feels off and the alignment of the buttons makes the player character feel far away. Also having the setting button so much smaller makes navigating less intuitive. Overall I am not a fan of it at all.

1. Please add an a toggle to make it always show the social menu instead of the dressing room avatar (or add a hotkey to see it immediately). I regularly check which of my friends are online, and hiding that behind an extra button press is extremely irritating. I have zero need for an immediate on-demand review of what I'm wearing.

2. Bring back the full settings menu button.

3. Put labels on the tiny buttons. I had no idea what two of three buttons were until I clicked on them. I thought the screenshot button would let me browse screenshots, not take one. I thought the book was to view a guide or something, not see achievements.

Not entirely keen on not being to see who is in the server with less easy access to change players roles. but also a security risk to streamers or YouTubers who are on Xbox or PC having their private friends shared globally when you are playing or adding people to a world.

I like the direction it's going, but the slightly transparent black box feels odd on the left side. Maybe a simple line or something on the end could fix it? I also can't stand how the settings are a tiny button meanwhile the marketplace takes up the part AFTER the resume button. It makes it unnecessarily annoying to change settings since I have to now press down 3 times just to change a feature. Maybe that can be fixed with switching the buttons so the current settings button is replaced with a market stall icon? It's highly inconvenient and overall kind of scummy.
I do not like these changes. The settings button should be one of the bigger options, not a small square on the bottom.
I think settings should stay where it was
Settings button must be below resume game no matter what.

This looks like absolute garbage. Why are you screwing with random menus rather than actually improving anything about the game?? The main world’s menu is disgusting now, and now so is the pause menu?? Half the screen doesn’t need to be a useless giant picture of my skin. This is completely unnecessary and unwelcome. The team behind Minecraft continues to do terrible crap like this to the game while repeatedly neglecting bugs, missing features, and community requests. Why is the offhand slot STILL not fully implemented in bedrock? Why don’t lava farms work on Java? Can just two Microsoft/mojang employees put in maybe three hours of work to actually improve Minecraft? It’s exhausting when every update continues to make the game look like vomit and improves nothing.
awful had some commands that used the leader board to display things and with that being gone now all of that is gone.
Settings shouldn't be at the bottom as thats where game settings go to. I think it should be swapped with the marketplace because to be honest people aren't looking at it while they play.

Despite all the previous feedback that Beta & Preview players gave about replacing the "Browse Add-Ons!" button with the "Settings" button, this updated game menu was still shipped to the main game with absolutely no changes or signs that Feedback was acted on.

It's sad to see Mojang prioritise profits over the player experience. Updating the UI of Minecraft should be about making navigation easier for users not making monetization easier for the corporation.
I liked being able to access my profile right from the menu, and also what was the need to tuck away the list of players present in a world?
Swap the "Browse Add-Ons!" with Settings Button.
Swap the settings and 'browse addons' buttons in the pause menu. I and many others keep going to the marketplace being mistaken for setting.

From the persecution of a pc player:
1. Settings button needs to be where the add-ons button is. No one pausing the game is doing so to spontaneously buy something from marketplace. I certainly haven’t. To take from an older comment: it feels like a malicious change to drive players to the marketplace store.
2. The inclusion of a dark mode is something that’s nice but needs to have a way to toggle it on or off.
3. The spacing for items is horrible, I don’t need for it to take 2-3 times as long to scroll to the settings I need (mainly noticed it on the video settings tab).
4. Getting rid of the player username is something that while doesn’t necessarily cause problems, it also doesn’t fix any problem.

Overall I don’t care the changes shown.
Is it even possible to see the current players list and their permissions now?

Not a fan of this whatsoever.  Settings button being so small and not labeled is uncomfortable. Would be better off turning the Marketplace into such and replace the current Browse Add-ons with Settings. I also feel it suits Minecraft like it always has to have the buttons centered. Perhaps also have an option to blur and darken the background while its active to make it easier on the eyes. Java has the perfect style, main menu and pause menu; simple, easy and accessible, maybe go in that direction? People will love it

This change was not done to improve ui. In fact, it reduces usability by hiding the settings button, which is often used during gameplay, to instead promote the marketplace button which is never used during gameplay. If i want to go shopping for content i would do from the main menu, since most of the time i would need to stop playing to apply the new content. It is clearly malicious, using the setting button old place to try and get us to enter the market by mistake. Come on, this is a game for kids, are you trying to get advantage on them with such lousy tricks? You are better than that. We know it. Prove it by reverting this change. As for now, no more marketplace for me and my kids, sadly.
Please do a setting where i can choose to use the old one
Why are you using malicious monetization tactics in a kids game?

Also going back from my previous critics on the main menu, worlds menu and pause menu which i think should be something like in Java or maybe even 1:1 layout that Java has (which is perfect: easy, simple, accessible). There is also a question. When will Bedrocks offhand ever be useful for anything more than holding rockets and a shield that barely ever blocks hits? How about fully implementing the combat update from ages ago? Because believe me, giving a slight cooldown on hits to MCPE and Controller players wont do any harm because hits still register as fast as on Java so spamming does nothing, slow regeneration is already making it even worse or MCPE and Controller players to explore and fight in the Nether, End or do Trials, fight against swarms. Its really not hard to make the game actually better, but you choose to take months to fix missing or broken pixels nobody ever notices and neglect actual bugs, or broken or missing features people want and now make not only the main menu, then worlds menu but now the pause menu horrifyingly ugly and uncomfortable?

This sucks. The settings tab should never have been replaced with browse addons. It feel clunky. The old one laid everything out so well and this one hides so much. I dont think this was a good decision. It feels like mobile but on console.

I can no longer take a quick glance at the other players on the world I am in. This is a very frustrating experience for multiplayer servers if you want to check who's online.

Please expose the Social tab like before. Or at least give parity to pressing Tab on Java Edition to see who's online.

I liked it better when i could see everyone in the sever and their ping. There should be an option to toggle this setting. I prefer seeing everyones ping to determine when a connection issue is limited to myself or serverwide

Ok, wow tons of things to say
1. The settings button should for SURE be a main button. I mean who actually presses pause to browse add-ons? I mean. Is Minecraft just becoming a cash-grab like every other game?
2. The "Game Is Paused" icon should for sure be more obvious to the player.
3. Add back player name!
4. The buttons for Mcpe are SO small. Fix PLEASE.
5. I don't mind the "social" button. But if I had to choose between it, and the old list on the right side. I'd always choose the old list in a heartbeat.
In conclusion. The entire menu is worse in my opinion, And clearly many others. I am always in my settings changing stuff and checking debug logs. Having to go all the way to the bottom to get to my settings is absolutely horrible. The list on the right side of the menu was great. It let me easily change somebody else's permissions and do many other great things including seeing every other player within 2 seconds of pressing pause. but having to go to social just to see it is way way worse.
Again I'm gonna talk about how small the buttons are for phone, i really do not see a point in making SETTINGS so small even though one of the points for this was to make it more accessible for mcpe. So why make it even harder? There is no need to have a major button to be add-on related. If in the case people DO want something related to add-ons it really isn't that much harder. But it happens less often so just bring back the settings to the major buttons if anything. Thanks alot

This is an awful change. Settings is gone. Your character is too large and out of balance with the left side of the screen. It's shoved all the way to the right of the screen and off center. It's bad design. Achievements are also gone, so you can easily reference them.
Expose the Social sidebar like before. This is affecting my experience with multiplayer worlds since I can no longer take a quick look on who's online.

I hate it, heres why:
-In multiplayer worlds, the pause menu was an easy way to see how many people were online
-Why make settings smaller? Its the most commonly used button in that menu, as opposed to dressing room, which players use very rarely, unless they need to reset their skin because bedrock is horrible at loading skins
-the blatant attempt to force microtransactions down our throat
Overall i dont like it, pls make a button in settings that lets me choose from the old one and the new one.

You can no longer see who is online on a realm when pausing the game. This makes is hard to moderate and manage players on the realm. Immediate access to the users playing allows owners to quickly resolve problems like griefing. 

Having to click through a "social" link to a hodgepodge list of online realm players + friends list is not user friendly.

This entire menu looks so odd. It is so hard to see the player list now, and the skin is HUGE. Stop downgrading all these menus and not giving players a option to use the old (better) ones! Not a single good change has been made with these awful new menus.
It sucks please swap the locations of the "browse addons" and settings button so itd be higher than a 5/10
The ui was good enough already no need to make it worse, put this effort into fixing bugs

This updated UI with the "social" crap in place where the list of players was is horrendous. 
Now it is at least 2 clicks to view the list of other players online. Also the players "score" is no longer visible.

Please revert this design change, this is not an improvement.

bro this is terrible Minecraft u need to fix this everyone is hating this the Ogs the people that have been playing for a while will understand absolute dog poop change it back now it takes me like an entire minute just to get out of the app this is absurd pls vote this out of here Minecraft not just me but most no all of us are disappointed in u

what the hell is this i hate how everything is just so terrible just terrible everything overall is just stupid if some 6-year-old iPad kids like it no one care no actual human would vote for this out now Bruh this is terrible change it back the old old one that looked nice and clean and EASIER TO USE

the other one was way better if they keep this, I'm sure me and a lot of others will end leaving soon

just absolutely awful update Minecraft needs to get their senses back
The design itself is good, but the settings button and marketplace button should be switched.

The settings button should be returned to its place below “Resume Game”.

The marketplace button having taken that place suggests that it’s more important than settings, which it’s not. I don’t mind if marketplace has a full size button at the bottom of the list but this new UI is trying too hard to trick players into entering the shop.
I feel that the browse add-ons button and the settings button should be swapped

Honestly, this one sucks compared to the original (previous) one. In my opinion, Microsoft should revert this pause UI to the previous one, BUT, with the exception of, where the players list is, have that be a black transparent box like the current one is (tho being on the right side, under the players list.). This design, i get it, trying to be more "mobile friendly" and more "minimalistic", but the older one is that. This also just DOES NOT go with a sandbox game such as Minecraft.

I dont know about everyone else; But I genuinely HATE this new UI. Along with the updated way to chat; it just makes for a overall worse experience. Its all over the place, scoreboards will be messed up, and the way that it looks is just overall worse than the old UI. Please add a personal option to revert back to it. Same thing with the old UI for realms and servers. The updated UI makes for a overall worse game experience overall, as trying to join realms is near impossible and solely based off of when your game registers theres a open slot(some are WAY faster than others.)
PLEASE add a option to revert back to the old UI.
This sucks, also the game is completely bugged as of 1.21.120 (Windows 11 PC), it took 3 days to get the update and now I can't log into my account on Bedrock, I get error code Drowned...
I think the Browse Addons button should replace the settings button.

Honestly, I think Minecraft should have more Ore UI. So we can have a ore UI design on the pause menu.

Of course I am saying the good Ore UI from Dessee UI from MCPEDL.

hello pls remove the new thing in the update my cancel menu button was e but now while I'm chatting the most common letter e if i click it twice my entire message gets deleated  absolute stupidity pls change everything back

everyone just for u guys to know if u guys like the comments disliking this new update,

they will remove it so don't  hesitate to do so

To anybody from Microsoft/Mojang reading this, hello. I have barely any problems with the pause menu, it's decent, but my main gripe with the new pause menu stems from both the button priority, and the Marketplace. The new pause menu took away my muscle memory from the previous pause menu and now, i mistakenly click the MARKETPLACE button, when i ACTUALLY want to go to the SETTINGS. It's annoying, i got used to it, but other players might want the buttons swapped, for more accessibility for people with a short attention span. Speaking of the marketplace, the advertising is getting out of hand. There's nothing wrong with it, it's fine, but i much prefer the Marketplace from the Legacy Console Version, where in that edition, the Marketplace's advertising was less "in-your-face" than Bedrock. Now, let's get on to the problems with the Marketplace itself. The Marketplace has some good stuff, like Actions and Stuff, or the Sonic Add-on, but PLEASE. Some QUALITY CONTROL would be appreciated. I cannot stress how many times i've seen add-ons that are just shameless and don't even try to set a high standard. Bedrock is the Edition with official add-ons support and possibly more customization than Java, so it should have some level of quality next to Java mods. If this message gets ignored, fine by me. But AT LEAST try to consider some decency with Bedrock Edition.

Id say that removing the friends list is an absolutely terrible, horrific change with no upside - unless its planned to be replaced with the Java tab list or some equivalent.

Many use the list display feature to see who's in the game. It's imperative that it's accessible quickly, with only the one button press. Especially since it already stops a player from being able to play the game.

Using the scoreboard, one could assign scores, numbers, to each player, which could be read on the pause menu. And using addons, people could give colors to the players in the pause menu, something which I use a lot.

It would be greatly appreciated if this change were reverted, or if the Java tablist were brought into the game, or if this new UI was optional / could be swapped for the previous UI in a menu.

I’m not a massive fan of it, Ive been playing Minecraft for a long time and I am use to where settings is SND now I keep clicking on marketplace instead of settings, my sister joined Minecraft for the first time since to updated and she has been for as long as me (7 years) and she was very confused where the button was. As well, some addons used the old ui to an advantage for a scoreboard to keep track pf lives etc please change it back
I can't find my settings anymore

1. as a player who has played a long time, i personally think that it needs work. 
  2. as an example, the settings button should be put back where it was,

Put the settings button back. This is a very malicious change that relies on players' muscle memory to make them click the Marketplace (who even bothers using that). Settings is a commonly used menu option yet you STILL made it a small button (that's beyond me).

No one asked for this, it's a greedy change that isn't welcome.

Can we also STOP changing things when LITERALLY NO ONE had a problem with it? 9 times out of 10 it just causes problems. I know you want more money but can we just start making it legitimately rather than using incredibly scummy practices??

Sorry for the slight rant, I just see these types of changes everywhere and wanted to give my thoughts on it

so i play minecraft on my TV using my xbox. I play on controller. the problem with that is that i use the settings button a lot. settings has always been under play/resume game so because it has always been this way and i know i just have to press: menu button => down => A when i want to access my settings but this change is simply just unnecessary and is clearly meant to take advantage of the player's muscle memory so that they will enter the marketplace more. now I love this game but when the developers focus on adding a marketplace button that is just meant to confuse long time players instead of fixing bugs that have existed for so long that i have to get used to them really makes me wonder where this game is really going.

This UI is absolutely horrendous and it only reinforced my idea why bedrock edition is borderline unusable. Not only is this potentially predatory, but there was no real reason to redesign this menu in the first place. It sure looks more compact now, but that doesn't mean it is better.

Settings button is now overly small and this menu is really important. Hey, if you want to see which biomes you have to explore, go to the world folder (%appdata% , .minecraft, saves, then select your world), then got to the sub-folder "advancement", open the file with notepad and search (ctrl + f) "adventuring".
